description: Pillai's arithmetical function: sum of gcd(k, n) for 1 <= k <= n.
comments: a(n) is the number of times the number 1 appears in the character table of the cyclic group C_n. - Ahmed Fares (ahmedfares(AT)my-deja.com), Jun 02 2001a(n) is the number of ways to express all fractions f/g whereby each product (f/g)*n is a natural number between 1 and n (using fractions of the form f/g with 1 <= f,g <= n). For example, for n=4 there are 8 such fractions: 1/1, 1/2, 2/2, 3/3, 1/4, 2/4, 3/4 and 4/4. - Ron Lalonde (ronronronlalonde(AT)hotmail.com), Oct 03 2002Number of non-congruent solutions to xy = 0 mod n. - Yuval Dekel (dekelyuval(AT)hotmail.com), Oct 06 2003Equals row sums of triangle A127375. - _Gary W. Adamson_, Aug 27 2008Conjecture: n>1 divides a(n)+1 iff n is prime. - _Thomas Ordowski_, Oct 22 2014a(n) is the number of 0's in the multiplication table Z/nZ (cf. A000010 for number of 1's). - _Eric Desbiaux_, Jun 11 2015
